my name is George Burgess I serve as

it's a wilderness experience if you're

going to be some risk and it's our duty

can go out in groups their safety in
numbers as a reason why fishes are in
school and antelopes are in herds is
because there's the safety there so go
together as a group don't go to come ice

shark go after after the lonely person
don't go in the water between dusk and

where sharks are likely to be found in
le'ts channels you see sea birds diving
to see fishes jumping if you see humans
fishing off the shoreline that means
there's fish around if there's fish
there's probably sharks so just by doing
those sort of common-sense kind of
things we can reduce our risk if you see
a shark while in the water of course the
first thing to do is to get out if you
can and that seems obvious to to most
people but surfers in particular who a
swim a lot in the water and see sharks
